alert.note: Alert for Bath; Elliott; Johnson; Magoffin; Martin; Montgomery; Rowan (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 01 at 3:01AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Powell, southeastern Montgomery, northwestern Martin, Morgan, southeastern Bath, northern Johnson, Menifee, north central Magoffin, southern Rowan and southern Elliott Counties through 400 AM EDT... At 301 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Ratlitt, or near Frenchburg, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Wellington, Big Woods, Dan, Korea, Yale, Artville, Zilpo and Cogswell around 305 AM EDT. Kellacey, Ebon, Paragon, Bangor, Omer, Lick Fork and Ezel around 310 AM EDT. Henry, Yocum, Zag, Blaze, Dehart, Leisure, Twentysix, Licking River, Woodsbend and Craney around 315 AM EDT. West Liberty, Lick Branch, Wrigley, Pomp, Index, Gordon Ford and Lytten around 320 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Steele, Elkfork, Lenox, Elamton, Little Sandy, Florress, Cottle, Crockett, Moon, Jeptha, Mima, Dingus, Isonville, Silverhill, Keaton, Gillem Branch, Relief, Elna, Ophir, Culver, Barnrock, Flatgap and Redbush. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Bath; Elliott; Johnson; Magoffin; Martin; Montgomery; Rowan
